segment.source: Start a Recording
segment.target: Start a Recording

segment.source: Start a Recording
segment.target: Start a Recording

segment.source: Start a Recording
segment.target: Start a Recording

segment.source: This procedure describes how to start a Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording from the user interface (UI).
segment.target: This procedure describes how to start a Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording from the user interface (UI).

segment.source: For information about how to start a recording from the command line, see WPR Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For information about how to start a recording from the command line, see WPR Command-Line Options.

segment.source: WPR requires Windows 7 or later version operating system.
segment.target: WPR requires Windows 7 or later version operating system.

segment.source: To start a recording
segment.target: To start a recording

segment.source: On the Start screen, click Windows Performance Recorder.
segment.target: On the Start screen, click Windows Performance Recorder.

segment.source: To run the default profile, click Start.
segment.target: To run the default profile, click Start.

segment.source: Or, to view and use other profiles, click More options.
segment.target: Or, to view and use other profiles, click More options.

segment.source: In the Select profiles for performance recording box, select at least one profile.
segment.target: In the Select profiles for performance recording box, select at least one profile.

segment.source: You can optionally add a custom profile.
segment.target: You can optionally add a custom profile.

segment.source: To do so, click Add Profiles, navigate to the profile that you want, and then click Open.
segment.target: To do so, click Add Profiles, navigate to the profile that you want, and then click Open.

segment.source: Under Custom measurements, select the profile.
segment.target: Under Custom measurements, select the profile.

segment.source: From the Performance scenario drop-down list, select the scenario that you want.
segment.target: From the Performance scenario drop-down list, select the scenario that you want.

segment.source: Unless the recording is for an on/off scenario, select General.
segment.target: Unless the recording is for an on/off scenario, select General.

segment.source: You can optionally record at the light detail level.
segment.target: You can optionally record at the light detail level.

segment.source: (Verbose is the default.level.) To do so, select Light in the Detail level drop-down list.
segment.target: (Verbose is the default.level.) To do so, select Light in the Detail level drop-down list.

segment.source: To log the recording to a file, select File in the Logging mode drop-down list.
segment.target: To log the recording to a file, select File in the Logging mode drop-down list.

segment.source: Memory is the default logging mode, except for on/off transition logs, which must be logged to a file.
segment.target: Memory is the default logging mode, except for on/off transition logs, which must be logged to a file.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: For longer recordings, select Memory.
segment.target: For longer recordings, select Memory.

segment.source: When you select File, the file can grow very large because the only limitation to the file size is the available disk space.
segment.target: When you select File, the file can grow very large because the only limitation to the file size is the available disk space.

segment.source: Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) cannot analyze extremely large files.
segment.target: Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) cannot analyze extremely large files.

segment.source: Click Start to begin recording, or click Cancel to end without recording.
segment.target: Click Start to begin recording, or click Cancel to end without recording.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you start WPR while another application is recording (such as Xperf or an application that uses NT Kernel Logger, such as logman or PerfTrace), WPR will not immediately detect that a recording is taking place and it will initially display a message that recording has not started.
segment.target: If you start WPR while another application is recording (such as Xperf or an application that uses NT Kernel Logger, such as logman or PerfTrace), WPR will not immediately detect that a recording is taking place and it will initially display a message that recording has not started.

segment.source: However, if you try to start a recording in WPR during the time that another application is recording, WPR will detect a conflict and prompt you with the following query:
segment.target: However, if you try to start a recording in WPR during the time that another application is recording, WPR will detect a conflict and prompt you with the following query:

segment.source: To stop the current session, click OK.
segment.target: To stop the current session, click OK.

segment.source: WPR will start to record.
segment.target: WPR will start to record.

segment.source: Note that this action can impact the application that started the cancelled session.
segment.target: Note that this action can impact the application that started the cancelled session.

segment.source: To allow the current session to continue, click Cancel.
segment.target: To allow the current session to continue, click Cancel.

segment.source: In this case, WPR does not start a recording and the other application is not affected.
segment.target: In this case, WPR does not start a recording and the other application is not affected.
